Title: Enhanced targeted anticancer potential of AKT-1 siRNA, an inhibitor of Protein Kinase B, in combination with silver nanoparticle against non-small cell lung adenocarcinoma
Abstract: © 2018 Elsevier B.V.In the present study the non invasive approach combining the small interference RNA (RNAi) based oncogenic suppression and silver nanoparticle (AgNP) effect to achieve efficient lung cancer combination therapeutics with minimal toxicity to normal lung cells was investigated. Direct electroporation technique was performed on both cancerous (A549) and normal lung (L132) cells targeting the AKT-1 gene expression. Interestingly the investigation showed significant down-regulation of AKT-1 siRNA gene expression by combined effect of AKT-siRNA and AgNP treatment in A549 cells when compared to their alone effect. Based on above findings and previous reports the plausible molecular mechanistic pathway was proposed. This study put further impetus in the development of nanotherapeutics combining AgNP and AKT-1 siRNA for efficient lung carcinoma treatment.
SubjectAreas: Atomic and Molecular Physics, and Optics
